summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Jackson Street, from First Avenue South to Railroad Avenue, all in the City of Seattle, by paving the same with brick laid upon property concrete foundation, and by constructing granite curbs, sewers, including all necessary appurtenances, water mains, together with all necessary appurtenances, including fire hydrants, accordance with Resolution No. 936 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Immediate Payment," under provisions of Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
